subject: Personal Finance
title: Prices Always Rise
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Prices Always Rise.

hook.text: A movie ticket cost 25 cents in 1940. Today it costs $12. The movie didn't get 48 times better.

buildup.text: Inflation means the general price level rises over time, reducing what each dollar can buy.

discovery.text: It's not that things get more expensive. It's that money gets less powerful.

twist.text: Moderate inflation is considered normal and even healthy. Economists worry when it disappears.

climax.text: Central banks actually target about 2% inflation per year. Zero inflation isn't the goal.

punchline.text: Rising prices are the plan, not the problem.

quiz.question: What does inflation actually mean?
options: Money loses purchasing power over time
